definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

square/power or involution (math.)/upright/honest/fair and square/direction/side/party (to a contract, dispute etc)/place/method/prescription (medicine)/just when/only or just/classifier for square things/abbr. for square or cubic meter
to bloom/to open/to be open (to the public)/to open up (to the outside)/to be open-minded/unrestrained by convention/unconstrained in one's sexuality
to release/to set free/to liberate (a prisoner)/to discharge
to feel relieved/to feel reassured/to be at ease
to liberate/to emancipate/liberation/refers to the Communists' victory over the Nationalists in 1949/CL:次[ci4]
to reform and open to the outside world/refers to Deng Xiaoping's policies from around 1980
to input/to throw in/to unload/to put into circulation
to set up/to arrange/to lay out
to lay down/to put down/to let go of/to relinquish/to set aside/to lower (the blinds etc)

sentences.english: I authorize you to hit 'em a tremendous whack.
sentences.chinese: 我授权你们，向他们放一排狠毒的排枪。

sentences.english: The room ha great importould like closet. You can put your totes in it.
sentences.chinese: 房间里有一个很大的壁橱，你能够把你的行李放出来。

sentences.english: The landlord put a new stove in my room.
sentences.chinese: 房东在我房间里放了一个新暖炉。

sentences.english: But the elements of that economic model are universal in character.
sentences.chinese: 但是这种经济模式的组成要素是放诸四海而皆准的。

sentences.english: Then I knew it was she who had put them there.
sentences.chinese: 然后我知道是她把那些花“放”在那儿的。

sentences.english: Pick up the "Duke of Earl" one there.
Now lift up your weight and put the second section on top.
sentences.chinese: 拿开你的重物，放上第二页纸。

sentences.english: When in doubt, set something on fire.
sentences.chinese: 犹疑不决的时候，就便放把火吧。

sentences.english: On the table beside me burned a lamp, and near it lay a little box.
sentences.chinese: 我身边的桌上亮着一盏灯，灯旁放着一个小箱。

sentences.english: Basil will lose its freshness and shape if you place it in the refrigerator.
sentences.chinese: 罗勒如果放冰箱里，会变得不新鲜，而且还会走形。

sentences.english: He replaced the paper after reading it.
sentences.chinese: 他看完报，仍然放回原处。

sentences.english: Perishes , only blames opening which oneself has not put.
sentences.chinese: 沉沦，只怪，臫巳还没能学会放旳开。

sentences.english: Next,put a cherry in the middle.
sentences.chinese: 其次，在中间放一个樱桃。

sentences.english: I know you’re still mad at me for ditching you off.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你还在为我放你鸽子在生气。

sentences.english: When you stop SPINNING, it's always good to ease into a couple strokes of regular backstroke.
sentences.chinese: 转臂游结束后，最好放轻松游几下正常的仰泳。

sentences.english: She put a dollop if ice-cream in each bowl.
sentences.chinese: 她在每个碗里放了一团冰淇淋。

definition: to add less (of a spice etc)
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
to turn on the water/to let water out/to throw a game (sports)
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
to set up/to arrange/to lay out
to hold/to contain/to grasp/to take hold of/handle/particle marking the following noun as a direct object/classifier for objects with handle/classifier for small objects: handful
to let go/to cast/to let loose/to discharge/to give expression to
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit
